properties.description: This initiative includes policies that address the Dutch Baseline Informatiebeveiliging (BIO) controls specifically for the 'thema-uitwerking Clouddiensten' and include policies covered under the SOC2 and ISO 27001:2013 controls.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: B.09 - Privacy and protection of personal data
U.04 - Data and Cloud Service Recovery
U.06 - Data retention and data destruction
U.10 - Access to IT services and data
C.01 - Service management policy and evaluation guideline

metadata.displayName: Status if Windows Defender is not available on machine
metadata.description: Windows Defender Exploit Guard is only available starting with Windows 10/Windows Server with update 1709. Setting this value to 'Non-Compliant' shows machines with older versions on which Windows Defender Exploit Guard is not available (such as Windows Server 2012 R2) as non-compliant. Setting this value to 'Compliant' shows these machines as compliant.

metadata.displayName: Namespace exclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.

metadata.displayName: Namespace inclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes label selector
metadata.description: Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

schema.description: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all resources.

matchLabels.description: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of values, a key, and an operator.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty.

metadata.displayName: Would you like to restrict specific IP addresses?
metadata.description: Select (Yes) to allow or forbid a list of IP addresses. If (No), the list of IP addresses won't have any effect in the policy enforcement

metadata.displayName: Allowed IP addresses
metadata.description: Array with allowed public IP addresses. An empty array is evaluated as to allow all IPs.

metadata.displayName: Forbidden IP addresses
metadata.description: Array with forbidden public IP addresses. An empty array is evaluated as there are no forbidden IP addresses.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed images
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the resource creation. 'Disable' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Allowed registry or registries regex
metadata.description: The RegEx rule used to match allowed container image field in a Kubernetes cluster. For example, to allow any Azure Container Registry image by matching partial path: ^[^\/]+\.azurecr\.io\/.+$ and for multiple registries: ^([^\/]+\.azurecr\.io|registry\.io)\/.+$

metadata.displayName: Containers exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identify is the name of container. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the resource creation. 'Disable' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Image exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identifier is the image of container. Prefix-matching can be signified with `*`. For example: `myregistry.azurecr.io/istio:*`. It is recommended that users use the fully-qualified Docker image name (e.g. start with a domain name) in order to avoid unexpectedly exempting images from an untrusted repository.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster services should listen only on allowed ports
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the resource creation. 'Disable' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Allowed service ports list in Kubernetes cluster
metadata.description: The list of service ports allowed in a Kubernetes cluster. Array only accepts strings. Example: ["443", "80"]

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster containers CPU and memory resource limits should not exceed the specified limits
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the resource creation. 'Disable' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Max allowed CPU units in Kubernetes cluster
metadata.description: The maximum CPU units allowed for a container. E.g. 200m. For more information, please refer https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: Max allowed memory bytes in Kubernetes cluster
metadata.description: The maximum memory bytes allowed for a container. E.g. 1Gi. For more information, please refer https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster pods and containers should only run with approved user and group IDs
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the resource creation. 'Disable' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Run as user rule
metadata.description: The 'RunAsUser' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MustRunAsNonRoot requires the pod be submitted with non-zero runAsUser or have USER directive defined (using a numeric UID) in the image. RunAsAny allows any runAsUser to be specified

metadata.displayName: Allowed user ID ranges
metadata.description: The user ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use. Set 'max' as '-1' to skip max limit evaluation. Empty array blocks every defined value for 'MustRunAs'.

metadata.displayName: Run as group rule
metadata.description: The 'RunAsGroup' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MayRunAs does not require that 'RunAsGroup' be specified. RunAsAny allows any

metadata.displayName: Allowed group ID ranges
metadata.description: The group ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use. Set 'max' as '-1' to skip max limit evaluation. Empty array blocks every defined value for 'MustRunAs' and 'MayRunAs'.

metadata.displayName: Supplemental group rule
metadata.description: The 'SupplementalGroups' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MayRunAs does not require that 'SupplementalGroups' be specified. RunAsAny allows any

metadata.displayName: Allowed supplemental group ID ranges
metadata.description: The supplemental group ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use. Set 'max' as '-1' to skip max limit evaluation. Empty array blocks every defined value for 'MustRunAs' and 'MayRunAs'.

metadata.displayName: File system group rule
metadata.description: The 'FSGroup' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MayRunAs does not require that 'FSGroup' be specified. RunAsAny allows any

metadata.displayName: Allowed file system group ID ranges
metadata.description: The file system group ranges that are allowed for pods to use. Set 'max' as '-1' to skip max limit evaluation. Empty array blocks every defined value for 'MustRunAs' and 'MayRunAs'.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster containers should not share host process ID or host IPC namespace
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster containers should run with a read only root file system
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed capabilities
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Allowed capabilities
metadata.description: The list of capabilities that are allowed to be added to a container. Provide empty list as input to block everything.

metadata.displayName: Required drop capabilities
metadata.description: The list of capabilities that must be dropped by a container.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed AppArmor profiles
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Allowed AppArmor profiles
metadata.description: The list of AppArmor profiles that containers are allowed to use. E.g. [ "runtime/default", "docker/default" ]. Provide empty list as input to block everything.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster pods should only use approved host network and port range
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Allow host network usage
metadata.description: Set this value to true if pod is allowed to use host network otherwise false.

metadata.displayName: Min host port
metadata.description: The minimum value in the allowable host port range that pods can use in the host network namespace.

metadata.displayName: Max host port
metadata.description: The maximum value in the allowable host port range that pods can use in the host network namespace.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes cluster pod hostPath volumes should only use allowed host paths
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Allowed host paths
metadata.description: The host paths allowed for pod hostPath volumes to use. Provide an empty paths list to block all host paths.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes clusters should not use the default namespace
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes clusters should disable automounting API credentials
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy:Kubernetes clusters should not grant CAP_SYS_ADMIN security capabilities
metadata.description: 'Audit' allows a non-compliant resource to be created or updated, but flags it as non-compliant. 'Deny' blocks the non-compliant resource creation or update. 'Disabled' turns off the policy.
